net.objectzoo.delegates

Interface ActionAsync<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of the ActionAsync's parameter
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    EventAsyncDelegate<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ActionAsyncSupport, ActionToActionAsync, EventAsyncAdapter

    public interface ActionAsync<T>
    An ActionAsync is a reference to a procedure without return value that can be invoked asynchronously in another thread. With ActionAsync it is possible to track the status and outcome using the ActionAsyncResult returned upon invocation or by defining a Consumer as callback for the invocation.
    Author:
    tilmann

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ActionAsyncResult beginAccept(Consumer<ActionAsyncResult> callback, Object asyncState, T parameter)
      Asynchronously invoke this ActionAsync with the given parameter value, callback and asyncState.
      static <T> ActionAsync<T> from(Consumer<T> action)
      Converts the given Consumer to the interface ActionAsync using the default executor.
      static <T> ActionAsync<T> from(Consumer<T> action, Executor executor)
      Converts the given Consumer to the interface ActionAsync and executes asynchronous call using the given Executor.

    • Method Detail

      • from

        static <T> ActionAsync<T> from(Consumer<T> action)
        Converts the given Consumer to the interface ActionAsync using the default executor. Conversion is done using the adapter ActionToActionAsync.
        Parameters:
        action - the action to be converted

      • from

        static <T> ActionAsync<T> from(Consumer<T> action,
                               Executor executor)
        Converts the given Consumer to the interface ActionAsync and executes asynchronous call using the given Executor. Conversion is done using the adapter ActionToActionAsync.
        Parameters:
        action - the action to be converted
        executor - the executor used for the asynchronous calls

      • beginAccept

        ActionAsyncResult beginAccept(Consumer<ActionAsyncResult> callback,
                              Object asyncState,
                              T parameter)
        Asynchronously invoke this ActionAsync with the given parameter value, callback and asyncState.

        Associated with each call to beginInvoke is an ActionAsyncResult instance returned by the call and given to the callback that can be used to track the status and outcome of the invocation.

        Parameters:
        callback - the Consumer, if given to beginInvoke, is invoked upon completion of the ActionAsync's invocation and receives the same ActionAsyncResult that is returned by the call to beginInvoke.
        asyncState - the asyncState is an arbitrary reference that, if given to beginInvoke, can be retrieved from this invocations ActionAsyncResult.getAsyncState()
        parameter - the parameter value for the invocation
        Returns:
        the ActionAsyncResult associated with this asynchronous invocation
